[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure Data Access System (SDAS) defines requirements for a fault-tolerant, secure, and high-performance data retrieval system with restricted access control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SDAS ensures rapid data access, encrypted storage, automated error recovery, and controlled access for unauthorized users.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SDAS integrates with encrypted databases, error-handling mechanisms, and security monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SDAS provides a structured web UI, ensuring fast and efficient data retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SDAS operates on cloud-hosted and on-premise servers, supporting scalable performance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SDAS utilizes PostgreSQL for secure data storage, Node.js with Express for backend processing, and React.js for frontend interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SDAS ensures encrypted data transmission via TLS 1.3 and secure API interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SDAS is optimized for processing large datasets while maintaining low-latency performance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SDAS enables fast data retrieval, prevents system failures, and enforces secure access policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SDAS supports secure browser-based access with encrypted database integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SDAS links to authentication, data logging, and compliance monitoring services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SDAS enables secure and efficient data access, real-time monitoring, and fault recovery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SDAS is designed for authorized personnel requiring secure data retrieval, with restricted access for unauthorized users.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SDAS requires authentication, database availability, and adherence to security policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SDAS relies on data encryption, authentication mechanisms, and system-wide fault tolerance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Fault Tolerance: System capability to recover from failures.
Unauthorized Access: Limited access restricting unauthorized users to read-only mode.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall retrieve and display requested data within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure encrypted interactions with databases to maintain data integrity.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process large datasets while maintaining system stability (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall restrict unauthorized users to read-only access (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall prevent data loss and downtime through automated error recovery (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for seamless data access and structured navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall retrieve and display requested data within 5 seconds under normal load conditions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store and manage large datasets securely, enforcing access control policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall maintain encrypted connections to secure all data transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data encryption, access control, and fault recovery best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and seamless data integrity.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Data retrieval speed, fault tolerance, and access restrictions validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API security policies, and system recovery documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: Data security standards, encryption policies, and access control guidelines.
